result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 090315 sentencing paid by county $72.50 for files 14cf585, 15cf134, 15cf85
9/3/15 - Sentencing
To linked case #15CF134.
Bond to be applied to restitution in linked case #15CF134.
Case - dismissed and read in.
In the amount of $6000.00
For restitution order - filed by ADA J Zapf.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:30am-  Matter heard with 15CF85 & 15CF134.  Victim rights compliance.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $6,000.00 - to be paid during the term of probation in 15CF134, count 2.  On the motion of the State, this case is dismissed & read-in.
9/2/2015 Plea hearing is rescheduled to 9/3/2015 at 8:30am by the Court.  Parties notified in court.
8/21/2015 Plea hearing is rescheduled to 9/2/2015 at 10am by the Court.  Parties notified via email.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:02am-  Matter heard with 15CF85 & 15CF134.  Victim rights compliance.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Attorney Parise is requesting an adjournment to allow him time to discuss the resolution w/ the DE.  Court grants request.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.

Parties jointly request 4/1/2015 Status conference be rescheduled to allow the DE time to complete the Living Free Program.  Status conference is rescheduled to 7/24/2015 at 9am.  Parties notified in court.
02-19-15 STC rescheduled to 04-01-15 at 9:30 am as agreed upon between Atty Parise and the DA's office and as the DE has new pending charges. Atty Parise to notify his client.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Defendant, Jeremy M. Benvenuto, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.    Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  943   DE has potential new charges of Felony DUI from 12-12-15being filed, no initial appearance has been held for new charged yet. Atty Parise seeks adjournment; State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.

State is requesting 12/11/2014 Status conference be rescheduled - victim has not made arrangements to meet w/ the State & discuss restitution.  Clerk advised parties that this is the last adjournment off the record due to restitution issues.  Status conference is rescheduled to 1/23/2015 at 9:30am.  NTBS by the Court.
No hearing held; no record made.  State getting more information re restitution amount.  Status conf. reset for 12/11/14 at 8:30.  ADA Jason Zapf and Atty Frank Parise given new hearing date.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frank Parise.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Court states his familiarity with the victim on the record but will not recuse himself at this time.  Parties have no objection to the Court hearing this case.  State requests more time to determine restitution amount.  Status conf. 11/13/14 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:07am-  Victim rights compliance.  Parties are jointly requesting an adjournment to attempt to resolve restitution issues.  Discussion held.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to October 30, 2014 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Parise is requesting 7/2/2014 Final pre-trial be rescheduled to allow him time to look into possible restitution issues.  State does not object.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 8/27/2014 at 9am.  Parties notified via email.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Frank Parise. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-2-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.
